title: SportsEventFrame
description: Schema for sports-related events (matches, fixtures, tournaments, seasons) backed by semantics.event.sports_event_frame.SportsEventFrame.

frame_type.description: Canonical frame family identifier; must be "event.sports" for sports events.

id.description: Optional stable identifier for the event (e.g. Wikidata QID or internal ID).

event_type.description: High-level label for the sports event type (e.g. "match", "tournament", "season", "fixture").

participants.description: Mapping from role label to entity-like objects representing teams, players, officials, etc. Common keys include "home_team", "away_team", "team1", "team2", "winner", "runner_up", "referee", "venue_owner".

time.description: Approximate time span when the event took place (single day, range of days, or season).

location.description: Location where the event took place (stadium, city, country, etc.).

properties.description: Additional semantic properties specific to sports events, such as scores, competition, stage, leg, aggregate scores, penalty shoot-out details, etc. Keys are project-defined.

extra.description: Arbitrary metadata not directly part of semantic content (e.g. original source payloads, debug info).

entity.description: Light-weight entity representation used inside event participants and properties.

id.description: Stable identifier for the entity, e.g. Wikidata QID.

name.description: Canonical label or surface-form name of the entity.

entity_type.description: Optional coarse type label for the entity (e.g. "team", "club", "player", "stadium").

time_span.description: Time span representation compatible with semantics.types.TimeSpan.

approximate.description: If true, the time span is approximate (e.g. a season or era rather than an exact date).

extra.description: Arbitrary metadata about the time span.

id.description: Stable identifier for the location, if any.

name.description: Human-readable label for the location (e.g. stadium or city name).
